PREVENTION PROGRAM DESCRIPTION  

The Atlas Cold Storage Prevention Program is built on the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard for ammonia refrigeration systems.  The first element in the safe function of ammonia refrigeration equipment is in the design itself. All components in the system were designed and installed in compliance with ANSI, ASHRAE, ASME,  Pressure Vessel Codes and all other applicable design safety standards in effect at the time of construction.  In order for this system to function safely and effectively over a long period of time, it must be properly maintained and monitored for system integrity and functional efficiency.  Maintenance and monitoring is accomplished by employees trained to follow safe procedures when operating the equipment from normal start-up to running and emergency shut-down. Also built into the system are automated and manual safeguards that monitor and maintain pressures, temperatures, liquid levels and warning systems that alert operators to respond early to operational deviations before they  become emergencies.

Operator training also includes participation in hazard analysis studies and emergency response procedures that permit hands-on practice in the use of personal protection equipment in an emergency scenario.  The hazard analysis ("what-if") checklist helps operators and emergency responders understand how to evaluate and manage an emergency situation safey and effectively in order to mitigate the potential releases.  Lock-out/tag-out, and line opening procedures are very important for preventing further hazards around malfunctioning equipment or when making even minor repairs on the system.

General employee training involves a knowledge of ammonia hazards, warning systems and evacuation procedures.  Coordinated emergency response planning is established with Montgomery County LEPC, and a written offsite emergency response plan is reviewed annually.

Atlas Cold Storage

Hatfield

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY OF
 THE EPA RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN 



Atlas Cold Storage Management has implemented the requirements of the Risk Management Plan at this location in order to operate this facility in accordance with regulations and support of best industry standards.  The ultimate objective is to minimize the risk of an accidental ammonia release.  The facility management has developed an Employee Emergency Action and Fire Prevention Plan.  Along with the emergency procedures and training, a plan is coordinated with local emergency responders to ensure a fast and efficient response in the event of an accidental hazardous material release, a fire or other emergency situation.  Atlas Cold Storage provides emergency response training for employees through the use of specialists in the industry that are authorized to train.  Atlas Cold Storage believes it is important that employees that participate in emergency response situations are adequately trained in handling emergency situations with anhydrous ammonia systems.  This specialized HAZMAT training follows the guidelines of federal, state and local regulatory agencies.

The management believes that cooperative emergency response training must include company employees, local emergency responders and regulatory agency people in order to provide a safe workplace and a safe environment.  In an emergency, all employees are trained to cooperate with other support personnel as directed by the Emergency Response IncidentCommander.                                                                                                                                                             
In order to prevent a potential accidental ammonia release at Atlas Cold Storage, the Company has an ongoing review process for design and operating procedures.  This assists in ensuring the refrigeration systems comply with OSHA, EPA and all other local, state regulatory agency safety standards, as well as its ow

n internal standards.
                                                                                                                                                                                      Atlas Cold Storage Hatfield is a refrigerated warehousing and distribution facility. The large majority of products stored are refrigerated foods for human consumption and inherently pose no known environmental or safety risks.  Ammonia, a regulated substance, is the commonly used refrigerant in industrial grade refrigeration systems that maintain low storage temperatures and can be safely managed by trained operators.  The ammonia refrigeration process functions within a closed piping network serving the facility operations.  The refrigeration systems in this facility contains approximately 30,654  pounds of ammonia inventory for this process.  Two refrigeration systems operate in individual cold storage warehouses on the property.  Plant 2 has an ammonia charge of approximately 12475 pounds and Plant 3 has an ammonia charge of approximately 18,179.


Atlas Cold Storage is committed to safe management and operation of the closed Ammonia Refrigeration System.  Maintenance employees are trained to observe operational procedures designed to be as fail-safe as possible to prevent accidental release of ammonia at any time.  Should any accidental release occur, all refrigeration employees are certified Emergency Hazardous Material Responders and are required to observe safe emergency response procedures.  They are trained to work in conjunction with the local Emergency Planning Commission to minimize the impact of any accidental releases.

As part of Atlas Cold Storage's safety programs, we have adopted the OSHA Process Safety Management Plan as required and is an integral part of our base safety manual.  The OSHA PSM Program has been implemented and covers the entire scope of safe operation of the ammonia refrigeration system from start-up and normal operations to poten

tial emergency response operations and turn around after emergencies.  Normal operations rely on the following:                                                              
? The Maintenance Management Procedures are used to perform preventative
 maintenance and to maintain records of all maintenance work performed.  This
 helps to ensure that the closed ammonia system continues to work safely,
 reliably and efficiently in the originally intended manner.
 
? Any set specifications of systems temperature, pressure, level or power 
 interruption, that are exceeded or violated will normally trigger an alarm and
 safety shutdown.  Maintenance technicians are notified of a deviation from
 normal operational specifications through indicator or alarm systems.
 
? In the event of deviations, technicians are trained to analyze the situation,
 follow personal safety procedures at all times, determine that everything
 is under control and correct problems and/or deviations.
 
? If a problem cannot be corrected immediately, the equipment needing
 repair service will be safely locked out of service until such time as
 repairs have been completed.
  
? If a problem cannot be safely handled by the Maintenance Personnel, procedures are in place to obtain the required resources to correct the situation.
 
During the past five years one accidental release at this facility that exceeded the reportable quantity of 100 pounds was reported to the appropriate agencies.  Leak in a section of piping resulted from a failure caused by a corrosive reaction with urethane manufactured insulation and the carbon steel pipe.   
 
 
 EMERGENCY READINESS INCLUDES THE THE FOLLOWNG PROGRAMS:
 
? Written procedures for emergency operations include emergency evacuation
 procedures, emergency shutdown instructions, emergency response training
, emergency response coordination with the LEPC, regulatory agency
 notification and other pertinent information.
 
? The Emergency Response Plan is a coordinated e

ffort with the LEPC  for managing emergency responses.                        and provides emergency contact information.  It also provides forms for logging                                                                    emergency operations from beginning to end of these operations and forms                                                                             to facilitate a systematic incident investigation and corrective measures to                                                                       prevent recurrence of a similar incident.
 
? The Emergency Response Training program includes all refrigeration
employees and close working relationship local emergency responders.  This establishes an effective
and informed mutual emergency response team that is familiar with system and
potential hazards in this facility.

It is the intent of Atlas Cold Storage to not only meet any regulatory requirement, but also take a pro-active approach into implementing these requirements as part of a working safety plan.  Atlas Cold Storage is in a constant review process of its operations and industry standards to provide a safe working environment for our employees, customers and neighbors.
